title: Raṣappa
description: A land (and later an Assyrian province) mentioned in first-millennium B.C. Akkadian texts from Assyria and Suhu. Scholars generally believe that this land/province is located east of the Habur River, south of Jebel Singar, and northeast of the land Bit-Halupê.

properties.description: Estimated, representative centerpoint based on location of Raṣappa shown on the map published in Bagg 2017 (RGTC 7/2-2).
properties.title: Representative centerpoint of Raṣappa
